snippet: The families of 43 kidnapped college students continue to lobby the government for justice — accompanied by students who lived through the 2014 attack....
abstract: Edgar Andres Vargas, Manuel Vazquez Arellano and Aldo Gutierrez Solano, survivors of Sept 26, 2014, incident in which 43 Mexican college students were murdered or kidnapped in Iguala, are still searching for answers following government's failed investigation.

byline.original: By KIRK SEMPLE and PAULINA VILLEGAS

lead_paragraph: The families of 43 kidnapped college students continue to lobby the government for justice — accompanied by students who lived through the 2014 attack.

headline.main: Two Years After a Night of Horror, Mexican Students Seek Answers
headline.print_headline: Two Years After a Night of Horror, Mexican Students Seek Answers

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Escuela Normal Rural Raul Isidro Burgos (Guerrero, Mexico)
